page.title: 13EROSION IN THE AREA
page.content: The major source of erosion in the area is the river Breamish.A possible cause of the erosion are the gravel works three miles or so down the river.As they have extracted the gravel so the river has tended to erode back up .This erosion has now moved several miles back up the bed of the river. Another cause of erosion is flooding by the river.In a severe flood in the winter of 84-5 a surge of water thought to be 6' high ran down the valley ripping away huge areas of bank.As well as this,the surge also damaged Ingram Bridge which has only just been repaired.Dramatic changes in the bed of the river also occurred.
